nexttext:
Where $a$  and $t$  are the limits of the operation, $\lambda$  is the order of the operation, and generally $\lambda\in R$ and $\lambda$ can be a complex number.

The three most used definitions for the general fractional differentiation and integration are the Grunwald-Letnikov (GL) definition \cite{Chen2010}, the Riemann-Liouville (RL) definition and the Caputo definition \cite{Oldham1974}.

The GL definition is given as
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{}_{a}D_{t}^{\lambda}\buildrel\Delta\over{=}{D^{\lambda}}=\left\{\begin{array}%
[]{ll}\frac{d^{\lambda}}{d{t^{\lambda}}},&R(\lambda)>0;\\
\\
1,&R(\lambda)=0;\\
\\
\int_{a}^{t}{(d\tau)}^{-\lambda},&R(\lambda)<0.\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mmultiscripts><mi>D</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>λ</mi><mprescripts/><mi>a</mi><none/></mmultiscripts><mover><mo movablelimits="false">=</mo><mi mathsize="142%" mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi></mover><msup><mi>D</mi><mi>λ</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mfrac><msup><mi>d</mi><mi>λ</mi></msup><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mi>λ</mi></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>;</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>;</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>λ</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi/></mrow></mrow></math>
